clinical_study.brief_title: Relation Between Accumulated Air Pollution Exposure and Subclinical Cardiovascular Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Relation Between Accumulated Air Pollution Exposure and Subclinical Cardiovascular Disease in 33 723 Danish 60-74 Years Old Males From the Background Population

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the association between individually cumulated air pollution exposure and 1) the presence and extent of CAC, 2) maximal infrarenal aortic diameter and presence of AAA, and 3) lowest measured ankle brachial blood pressure index or presence of PAD. If a relation exists, the analysis will be stratified by groups of air-pollutants. Furthermore, the examined association is also related to social class of participants to determine if a social inequality in the air pollution impact on subclinical cardiovascular diseases exists.

detailed_description.textblock: Cardiovascular disease is one of the main causes of death and disability in the Western world and there is increasing evidence that air pollution is a risk factor for developing subclinical cardiovascular diseases. We have a unique opportunity to evaluate this correlation. The DEHM/UBM/AirGIS model calculates air pollution in a high temporal and spatial resolution and track air pollution retrospectively back to year 1979. We link the results from this model to a population-based cardiovascular screening cohort of 33 723 individuals in the age of 60-74 to assess the contribution of the specific accumulated air pollution to the presence of subclinical arteriosclerosis in the coronary vessels, abdominal aortic aneurysms and peripheral arterial disease. This correlation will be further analyzed in relation to specific air pollutants.

primary_outcome.measure: Particles with diameter less than 2.5 µm (PM2.5), accumulated values.
Maximal infrarenal aortic diameter in mm and presence of abdominal aortic Aneurisme (Yes/N0)

primary_outcome.description: the total amount of calcium in the coronary artery

primary_outcome.measure: Measures of blod pressure on the ankle in mmHg and brachial in mmHg to determined periferal arterial disease (PAD)
primary_outcome.description: lowest measured ankle brachial blood pressure index or presence of PAD

arm_group.description: Enrolment started September 2014 and ended in February 2019. Approx. 24 000 were invited, and approx. 15 000 were examined.
Enrolment started October 2008 and ended January 2011. In all, 18 749 men were screened.

study_pop.textblock: Men aged 60-74 living in Southern Region of Denmark

criteria.textblock:
DANCAVAS study
Inclusion Criteria:
- male gender, age between 60-74 years living on the Island of Funen, or in the surrounding communities of Vejle, Silkeborg and Nykøbing Falster.
Exclusion Criteria:
- There were no exclusion criteria.
VIVA study
Inclusion Criteria:
- male gender, age between 65-74 years living in the region of Mid Denmark (Viborg County).
Exclusion Criteria:
There were no exclusion criteria.
